metadata.title: CVE-2023-4387 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in vmxnet3_rq_alloc_rx_buf indrivers/net/vmxnet3/vmxnet3_drv.c in VMware's vmxnet3 ethernet NIC driverin the Linux Kernel. This issue could allow a local attacker to crash thesystem due to a double-free while cleaning up vmxnet3_rq_cleanup_all, whichcould also lead to a kernel information leak problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4387` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-lowlatency - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1123-aws - 4.4.0-1123.129
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1149-azure - 4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.129').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1').
